column4: Hello I want to COMPLETELY UNISTALL BERYL.. delete settings and all.. NO BERYL..
do u believe .. or are u SURE ?
just added     "beryl-manager" command to the System > Sessions
you can try "sudo apt-get remove --purge beryl" and then "rm -r /home/user/.beryl*"
either use apt-get or synaptic. different tools to achieve the same thing.
